document.docTitle: Rhamnus cathartica var. cathartica Linnaeus var. cathartica
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of Rhamnus L. and Atadinus Raf. (Rhamnaceae) in Iran

subSubSection.paragraph: Description— Young branches pubescent with ovate, obovate or orbicular leaves.

Habitat and distribution —
The variety is an Euro-Siberian element of Gilan , Golestan and Mazandaran Provinces of N Iran . It grows at an altitude of
2260–2400 m
, between 33° and 36° N and between 49° and 54° E . The species occurs on slopes EW , S , E of rocky–pasture, heights of vallies and in forests or shrublands
.

Discussion —There is a high diversity in morphological characters, such as ovate or obovate to elliptic, orbicular or lanceolate leaves. A specimen of
R. cathartica var. cathartica
in the Calishum population was 50 cm high and spreading on rocks with many spines (while they are trees or shrubs, erect in forests, 2-4 m high, or rarely 1.5 m high with a few spines).

Note —
R. cathartica var. cathartica
, is a cosmopolitan species which grows in Iran and other countries almost up to 800 m , but in Slovakia and in the Ukranie they are reported to grow at an altitude 200–330 m .

Examined specimens—
